title: Drawing, "Wasserorgel", 1910–12
medium: Brush and blue, slate blue, orange, red and yellow gouache on white wove paper
inscribed:
On mount above colorways in black ink: Wasserorgel
On mount upper right in blue crayon: 331
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Abstract pattern of circles and U-shapes arranged in a closely placed horizontal alignment. Shapes are built up of overlapping colors of varying thickness.

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wasserorgel", 1910–12.
1910–12. Brush and blue, slate blue, orange, red and yellow gouache on white wove paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-57.
